item.title: The Avenue between Brondesbury Park and Aylestone Avenue, 6th August
item.description:
The state of this road! Especially southbound - the road is complete uneven with potholes all of the place. This road needs to be resurfaced ASAP - it is getting dangerous.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Avenue, London

item.title: Pothole maintenance, 6th August
item.description:
Resident has called to report a pothole in the pavement. This leads to residents dropped kerb. This has been slowing getting worse in the colder weather and needs to be repaired. Please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Amherst Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of 3 Buckland Crescent, 6th August
item.description:
I’m writing to raise a safety concern regarding recent road works carried out on Buckland Crescent, specifically in front of 3 Buckland Crescent, NW3 5DH. A few weeks ago, the road was closed for repairs, and while the resurfacing appears to have been completed, a large number of loose stones and small rocks have been left on the road surface. These loose materials are creating a significant hazard — vehicles are visibly losing grip and slipping, especially when turning or braking. This poses a serious risk to both drivers and pedestrians in the area. I kindly urge the Council to send a cleaning team to remove the debris as soon as possible, before an accident occurs. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please confirm once action has been scheduled.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belsize Park, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Make cycle way onto bridge safer - remove all the signs and cones, 6th August
item.description:
Hello I’ve been cycling Waterloo bridge daily for the last year and the filter system for cyclists entering onto the bridge is so poor and at times frankly dangerous. When is a more permanent cycle friendly solution being implemented?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Theatre Avenue, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light regulation off, 6th August
item.description:
The big crossing between Blackfriars Road and Southwark Street SE1 9GQ. Something is amiss with the lights. Pedestrians wait for an eternity, never seems to go green. Cars honking at each other, confusion. The lights do change eventually, but the frequency seems off.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfriars Road, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet
